actions.committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

official_title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow physicians a deduction for medical services provided to individuals who have no health plan coverage.

summary.text: Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow medical doctors an itemized deduction for the value of medical services provided: (1) without charge to an individual who is not covered by a health plan; and (2) without compensation pursuant to participation in a qualified health care organization. Provides that such deduction is not subject to the two-percent floor on miscellaneous itemized deductions.

titles.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to allow physicians a deduction for medical services provided to individuals who have no health plan coverage.
